div.h2: WELCOME TO WOODLAND R-IV SCHOOL DISTRICT
div.p: Woodland R-IV would like to welcome you to our brand new website! Feel free to explore the new web space by checking out some of our new features including: calendars, news, and blogs. Subscribe to our Facebook, Twitter, or RSS feeds to receive updates on school and district information! Or if you'd prefer, we've got an app for that!

img.alt: High School students getting community in the holiday spirits
img.title: High School students getting community in the holiday spirits

div.div: High School students getting community in the holiday spirits

p.style: font-family: arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.style: font-family: arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Every year, I am excited to see kids learn and grow. That learning and growth occurs because of a great staff, like the one we have here at Woodland R-IV, and a community that is willing to support their school in any way possible, just like the Woodland R-IV community. I want to do all I can to help carry on the proud tradition of excellence this school and community have built to this point, but I also want to seek new opportunities for our students to enhance their education. Respect the Past. Review the Present. Plan the Future. Please continue to support our students, teachers, athletic teams, academic teams, and support staff as we navigate yet another school year. I am sure it will contain many great moments to add to the Cardinal Tradition.

p.style: font-family: arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.span: Thanks for all you do for our kids! GO CARDS!

p.br: In accordance with Board of Education Policy 6190, eligible students may participate in virtual courses or a full time program of instruction through the Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program or virtual programs developed by or approved by the District. For more information, visit with your child’s building principal.

a.title: Spring Band Concert (Grades 7-12) at 7:00pm in the HS gym
a.span: Spring Band Concert (Grades 7-12) at 7:00pm in the HS gym

a.title: Tentative Last Day of School (Early Dismissal)
a.span: Tentative Last Day of School (Early Dismissal)

div.p: It is the mission of the Woodland R-IV School District to ensure that all students acquire the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to participate in an ever-changing society. This will be accomplished by ensuring that each child has access to appropriate and meaningful learning experiences to meet the demands of the 21st century. It is, therefore, the responsibility of the Woodland R-IV School District to provide an educational environment for children of the district which will foster and accelerate their moral, intellectual, physical, social, emotional, and career development.
